page.title: 14BLENHEIM PALACE, WOODSTOCK
page.content: Blenheim Palace is a very popular tourist attraction. On average 1,500 to 2,000 people go there a day. The busiest time is Summer and particularly Bank Holidays. The whole of Blenheim Park is 2,500 acres and the Palace itself covers a colossal seven acres. Blenheim employs from 80-180 workers, a large majority working in the 200 rooms in the Palace, the largest of which is 67 feet high. It also has an enormous library of over 10,000 books. Held in the Palace are banquets and concerts. Open air concerts are sometimes held. Blenheim also has an education service which provides tours round the Palace, farms and the Park. A conference centre, butterfly farm, restaurant and plant centre are other attractions. For local people the main attraction is walking in the Park.
